data.title: Chris Meloni reveals 'sweetest' story behind what he told Snoop Dogg at the Olympics
data.meta_description: "Law & Order: Organized Crime" star Christopher Meloni tells TODAY.com the story he told Snoop Dogg about his daughter and Ice-T at the 2024 Summer Games.
data.text:
Cats and one ‚ÄúDogg‚Äù in particular have played a special role in Chris Meloni‚Äôs and his family‚Äôs lives.

The ‚ÄúLaw & Order: Organized Crime‚Äù star is teaming up with cat treat brand Temptations to narrate a new season of their ‚ÄúCatch a Cat Burglar‚Äù podcast series. This second season, ‚ÄúCatch a Cat Burglar: Purry Duty,‚Äù will also get fans involved as a ‚Äúmysterious case‚Äù of a pet store robbery unfolds involving cats who will ‚Äúget their paws on the new Temptations Wet Cat Food,‚Äù according to a press release.

For Meloni, his history with cats dates back to when he first began dating his wife, Sherman Williams.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve never had a cat,‚Äù he explains in an interview with TODAY.com. ‚ÄúWhen I first started dating my wife, 35 years ago, she had two cats, and it was the first time I had any long-term, close relationships with a cat. Golly, if they didn‚Äôt ‚Äî they seduced me. So bad.‚Äù

Meloni hopes listeners will be ‚Äúon the edge of their seats‚Äù while tuning in to the show, which he infused with a fun ‚Äútwinkle‚Äù in his voice.

‚ÄúI saw it as a faux serious courtroom docudrama kind of thing,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúThe copy was funny so that I kind of attempted to make ‚Äî to give it this serious, tonal quality to the proceedings that are happening before you,‚Äù he adds, explaining it‚Äôs ‚Äúalmost like old-time radio.‚Äù

While Meloni‚Äôs wife had cats at one point in her life, the couple‚Äôs kids have not. The actor says his children, daughter Sophia, 23, and son Dante, 20, grew up with two dogs, one of which they still have.

Another ‚ÄúDogg‚Äù Meloni recently spent some time with is the rapper Snoop Dogg, who guest-starred on an episode of ‚ÄúLaw & Order: SVU‚Äù in 2019, eight years after Meloni departed that series. The two were recently spotted together attending the 2024 Paris Olympics.

On July 27, Meloni posted a photo with Snoop, and he recalls to TODAY.com the sweet story he passed along to the rapper during their conversation at the Games.

‚ÄúI gave him some tips on rap,‚Äù he jokes, before explaining what the two really discussed.

Meloni says his daughter interned for ‚ÄúSVU‚Äù a few years ago, and she came home from the set one day with the ‚Äúsweetest‚Äù story that involved Snoop and starIce-T.

‚ÄúShe said, ‚ÄòI just heard the sweetest thing at work today. I was bringing Ice-T some food in his dressing room, and he was on the phone. ‚Ä¶ I heard him talking to Snoop Dogg, and he said ‚Äî‚Äô And this was the conversation: ‚ÄòAll right, I miss you, too. Yeah, I love you, too, brother.‚Äô That was the conversation! She goes, ‚ÄòTwo OGs saying they love each other.‚Äô I told Snoop that story.‚Äù

Meloni says Snoop responded, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what it‚Äôs all about, man.‚Äù

‚ÄúI thought that was strong and powerful and pretty cool,‚Äù Meloni says.

Ice-T has recently showed his support for Snoop at the Olympics on X.

‚ÄúICE COLD FACT üí• @SnoopDogg hosting the OLYMPICS is TopTier HipHop Growth‚Ä¶ You better recognize,‚Äù he wrote.

Snoop has been having a ball with athletes and fans at the Olympics, where he‚Äôs offering commentary for NBC, and has even managed to catch the men‚Äôs street finals in skateboarding alongside Meloni.

This wasn‚Äôt Meloni and his wife‚Äôs first time at the Games. He says they attended the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta.

In Paris, they were able to see rugby, table tennis and beach volleyball, in addition to skateboarding, he explains.

‚ÄúIt was a great time,‚Äù he says.

Fans can stream the first four seasons of ‚ÄúLaw & Order: Organized Crime‚Äù on Peacock now, and listen to episodes of Meloni‚Äôs ‚ÄúPurry Duty‚Äù podcast with Temptations beginning Aug. 1. On Aug. 7, listeners can vote ‚Äúguilty‚Äù or ‚Äúnot guilty‚Äù on Spotify or the Temptations brand‚Äôs social media channels, before they learn the verdict in the final episode Aug. 15.

(Peacock is part of TODAY.com‚Äôs parent company, NBCUniversal.)
